thread.title: Restaurant inspections: Greene County Health Inspections
thread.title_full: Restaurant inspections: Greene County Health Inspections | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Staff
title: Restaurant inspections: Greene County Health Inspections
text:
The following are summaries of state of Ohio standard inspection reports on file from the Greene County Combined Health District, from the week of Aug. 17-21. District information is available online at www.gcchd.org/inspections.
Sunrise Cafe
259 Xenia Ave., Yellow Springs
Date of inspection: Aug. 21
Violations: Missing hand washing signage posted at front hand sink.
No towels at rear hand sink (corrected).
Portable fan (very dusty), table area under slicer, lids to bulk food containers, can opener holster, area in front of bread oven.
Slicer, can opener (correcting).
Cracked/damaged lexan pans (corrected).
Floor area under bulk food storage wire rack.
Damaged door seal and burned out light bulb to rear Traulsen reach-in cooler – repair/replace; damaged door seal to Beverage-Air freezer – replace; damaged door seal to grill cooler – replace.
Raw chicken stored above raw pork chop, raw fish stored above cooked chicken in rear Traulsen reach-in cooler (corrected).
Rear Traulsen reach-in cooler.
Found badly scored and peeling Teflon-lined skillets (PIC stated will remove from service).
Damaged floor tiles – repair/replace so final finish is smooth and easily cleanable; damaged ceiling by door going out to patio – repair; open wall area behind brick right of beer cooler – seal this vertical opening in the wall so it is smooth and easily cleanable.
No screen, standing open door out to patio and allowing flies to enter facility/kitchen.
Hot water in women’s restroom 131F; 135F in men’s restroom (recommend install mixing valves) (PIC stated will correct).
Raw sausage (45F), buffalo burgers (46F), chicken salad (47F), gyro meat (48F), feta cheese (45F), shell eggs (46-54F) (PIC stated will discard all out of temperature foods).
Working spray bottle of windex (corrected).
Spray bottle of Windex stored above food and food contact items across from cookline (corrected).
Employee drinking from screw-top can stored on top of dish machine – must be a container that won’t cause cross-contamination and stored where won’t create potential cross-contamination (educated PIC).
Employee handled ready to eat cut leafy greens with bare hands – salad discarded.
Comments: All violations must be corrected by September 11, 2015. All critical violations corrected today must also remain corrected. The floor tile and door seal issues must be corrected by October 16, 2015.
Spirited Goat Coffee House
118 Dayton St., Yellow Springs
Date of inspection: Aug. 21
Violations: No towels in dispenser at hand sink in bathroom.
No signage posted in bathroom.
Damaged floor tile at entrance into the food area – replace.
Less than to-foot-candles of illumination at the hand sink, warewashing sink and prep area. Increase illumination.
Self-serve cookies and donuts not properly labeled, list of ingredients and allergens not available.
Unlabeled ingredient squeeze bottles.
Cream cheese (60F) (discarded).
Door seals to reach-in units, interior portion to former food make table, counter area under espresso machine.
Damaged door seal to milk cooler – replace.
Floor area under refrigeration equipment.
